channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'Good signs' or just buying time? Spurs remain divided on Frank future
item.description: Many Tottenham fans have already lost faith in Thomas Frank - but did Tuesday's 2-0 win over Borussia Dortmund give cause for optimism?

item.title: 'Battered in Bodo' - is this more than just a blip for Man City?
item.description: Manchester City suffered their very own "hell of a beating" moment in Norway on Tuesday - now Pep Guardiola and his players must turn around their fortunes in an increasingly trying January.

item.title: 'Tears in my eyes' - Jesus enjoys 'dream night' in San Siro
item.description: Gabriel Jesus says he had "tears in my eyes" after scoring twice to help Arsenal win 3-1 at Inter Milan for a seventh successive win in the Champions League.

item.title: Bellingham responds to partying claims with 'joke' drinking celebration
item.description: Jude Bellingham responds to partying claims with a goal celebration in the Champions League win over Monaco.

item.title: Slot hints Salah will start for Liverpool in Marseille
item.description: Arne Slot suggests Mohamed Salah will return to the Liverpool starting line-up against Marseille in Wednesday's Champions League tie, insisting his relationship with the forward is "as normal as it's always been".

item.title: US opens priority visa appointment system for World Cup
item.description: World Cup 2026 ticket holders can now access priority visa appointments for travel to the United States - but doubt remains whether fans from every country to have qualified will be able to enter.

item.title: 'Everything is going wrong' - Guardiola on Bodo/Glimt upset
item.description: Pep Guardiola responds to his team's second defeat in four days as Manchester City lose at Bodo/Glimt in the Champions League.

item.title: Watch: Livingston 1-1 St Mirren highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as St Mirren's Alex Gogic scores a late equaliser to deny Livingston their first victory in the Scottish Premiership since early August.

item.title: Salford edge Swindon to set up Man City FA Cup tie
item.description: Luke Garbutt scores a sublime free-kick as Salford beat Swindon 3-2 in the FA Cup third round to set up a glamour tie with seven-time winners Manchester City.

item.title: Arsenal depth of quality 'incredible' - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta was delighted with Gabriel Jesus's display and two goals in the 3-1 Champions League win at Inter Milan, showing the "incredible" depth of quality in his squad.

item.title: Frank on how he is managing the pressure at Spurs
item.description: Thomas Frank feels his Tottenham Hotspur side are getting better and that he deserves patience following their two goal win over 10-man Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League.

item.title: Villa interested in Mateta - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Aston Villa explore Jean-Philippe Mateta and Tammy Abraham moves, Manchester United decline Ajax's Manuel Ugarte approach and Bournemouth fight to keep Marcos Senesi.

item.title: Champions League quiz: Name every city to host a final
item.description: The Champions League and its forerunner the European Cup have a combined 70-year history. Can you name all the cities that have staged the final of the men's competition?

item.title: Stunning late goal earns Brighton draw against Bournemouth
item.description: Teenager Charalampos Kostoulas scores a stunning overhead kick to deny Bournemouth a rare away victory in the Premier League.

item.title: 'Everything Spurs do ends up feeling like disappointment'
item.description: Rory Smith believes Tottenham are stuck in a "stagnant" phase, with expectations to compete at the top but without the resources.

item.title: Brighton equaliser more than deserved - Hurzeler
item.description: Brighton boss Fabian Hurzeler feels his side more than deserved a 1-1 draw against Bournemouth and is full of praise for teenager Charalampos Kostoulas who netted a stunning late equaliser.

item.title: Late goal 'very harsh' on Bournemouth - Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth boss Andoni Iraola feels it was "very harsh" on his side to concede a late goal away at Brighton, but admits the Cherries were unable to keep control of the game in the second half.

item.title: 'We had a good conversation' - Frank on Tottenham board support
item.description: Under-pressure Tottenham Hotspur head coach Thomas Frank says he has the support of the club's board, as they prepare to take on Borussia Dortmund in the Champions League.

item.title: Fulham in talks to sign Man City winger Bobb
item.description: Fulham are in talks to sign winger Oscar Bobb from fellow Premier League side Manchester City.

item.title: Why Iraola's Bournemouth future is uncertain
item.description: With his contract expiring in the summer, Andoni Iraola's future at Bournemouth is unclear after two successful seasons in charge.

item.title: The day I discovered the Everton contract Revie never signed
item.description: This is the story of how an unsigned contract that lay hidden in a bungalow for more than 50 years could have changed the course of English football.

item.title: Return of the 0-0 - is the Premier League getting boring?
item.description: Two goalless fixtures at the weekend mean this season's Premier League has already featured more 0-0 draws than the whole of last term – but does that mean the league has been boring?

item.title: Refs' boss Webb backs officials over Dalot incident
item.description: Premier League referees' boss Howard Webb rejects claims that his officials made a mistake by not sending off Diogo Dalot in Saturday's Manchester derby.

item.title: Will Frank and Glasner see the season out?
item.description: Match of the Day's Kelly Cates, Joe Hart and Ellen White discuss whether it is possible for Tottenham manager Thomas Frank and Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner to remain at their clubs until the end of the season.

item.title: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa
item.description: Everton's Thierno Barry capitalises on a mistake by Aston Villa's Emi Martinez for a 1-0 win to The Toffees, which stops Villa going second in the Premier League.

item.title: Rashford scores but Barcelona suffer shock defeat
item.description: La Liga leaders Barcelona suffer a shock defeat by Real Sociedad despite a goal from substitute Marcus Rashford.

item.title: Everton disallowed goal frustrating but right decision - Hart
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Joe Hart says Everton players and fans are right to be "frustrated" by their disallowed goal against Aston Villa, it was the correct decision.

item.title: Watch: Highlights as Celtic beat Auchinleck in Scottish Cup
item.description: Watch highlights as Celtic overcome a brave backs-to-the-wall effort from sixth-tier Auchinleck Talbot to reach the last 16 of the Scottish Cup.

item.title: Newcastle miss out on top-five spot in draw with Wolves
item.description: Wolves held Newcastle United to a goalless draw to prevent Eddie Howe's side from climbing into the top five of the Premier League table.

item.title: How is Premier League doing in race for five Champions League places?
item.description: With the top three in the Premier League pulling away, could fifth be enough for Champions League football again?

item.title: Liverpool midfielder Hobinger was sent underwear pictures by stalker
item.description: Father-of-two Mangal Dalal, 42, is given a restraining order for stalking the Reds midfielder.

item.title: Bournemouth sign midfielder Toth for £10.4m
item.description: Bournemouth sign Hungary international Alex Toth for £10.4m from Ferencvaros, with the midfielder joining the Cherries on a five-and-half-year contract.

item.title: Canadian league set to trial Wenger's offside idea
item.description: The Canadian Premier League is given permission to trial Arsene Wenger's "daylight" offside rule.

item.title: Marseille in talks with Arsenal over Nwaneri loan
item.description: French club Marseille are in talks to sign Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on loan for the rest of the season.

item.title: Man Utd's complicated relationship with Class of 92
item.description: Manchester United and the class of 92 have a complicated relationship. But is it a problem?

item.title: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
item.description: Charalampos Kostoulas earned Brighton a point with a stunning overhead kick but were the Seagulls right to be angry over an earlier penalty award?

item.title: Huddersfield appoint Manning as head coach
item.description: League One Huddersfield Town appoint former Norwich and Bristol City boss Liam Manning as head coach.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Hellberg believes Hackney wants to stay at Boro
item.description: Middlesbrough boss Kim Hellberg says he believes midfielder Hayden Hackney wants to stay with the Championship club, despite interest from Manchester United.

item.title: Man City sign Guehi from Palace - what will he bring?
item.description: Man City sign Crystal Palace captain Marc Guehi for £20m - but what will the England defender add to Pep Guardiola's side?

item.title: Who will win title race between Hearts, Celtic & Rangers?
item.description: Charlie Adam, Paul Hartley and Barrie McKay give their thoughts about a three-horse Scottish title race between Heart of Midlothian, Celtic and Rangers.

item.title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's Afcon triumph
item.description: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

item.title: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
item.description: This is Mikel Arteta and Arsenal's "now or never" moment as Premier League title rivals stumble badly, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: 'Results, results' - how Guardiola outlasted five Man Utd bosses
item.description: Pep Guardiola takes on a sixth different Manchester United boss in Saturday's derby as he approaches a decade at City, but how has he outlasted all of those before Michael Carrick?

item.title: Boots from Easter Bunny and teenage parties - Glasner tells his story
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his background and career in football.

item.title: From Fiji to Latvia - are cross-border leagues the future?
item.description: The OFC Professional League kicks off this week and a Baltic League has been proposed, so is there a future for cross-border football competitions?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Why is there no VAR in the FA Cup third and fourth round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why VAR is not in use in the third and fourth rounds of the FA Cup.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Celtic agree deal for striker Cvancara - gossip
item.description: Celtic close in on forward, Rangers winger nears Kilmarnock loan and leading Aberdeen candidate emerges.

item.title: Hearts seal Mato deal after Shankland injury blow
item.description: Hearts face up to two months without injuredcaptain Lawrence Shankland, while the Scottish Premiership leaders agree a deal to speed up the signature of Rogers Mato.

item.title: Football worth over £800m to Scottish economy
item.description: Research by the Fraser of Allander Institute finds that the beautiful game supports more than 14,000 jobs across the country.

item.title: Roma sign forward Malen from Aston Villa
item.description: Netherlands forward Donyell Malen joins Roma from Aston Villa after just one year with the Premier League side.

item.title: Who will Crystal Palace face in Conference League play-off?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks at who Crystal Palace could face in the Conference League play-off draw and explains how the draw works.

item.title: Bayern's record-breaking Bundesliga season in numbers
item.description: BBC Sport examines the stunning numbers behind Bayern Munich's record-breaking start to the Bundesliga season - and what records they could topple.

item.title: 'If Flick hadn't come, I would have left Barca' - Raphinha
item.description: Raphinha has become one of Barcelona's most dependable performers and a decisive figure in their biggest matches, which he credits Hansi Flick for.

item.title: Tottenham sign Gallagher from Atletico for £35m
item.description: The former Chelsea midfielder joins Spurs on a deal until 2031.

item.title: City Ground to host England-Iceland qualifier
item.description: England will host Iceland in a Women's World Cup qualifier on 7 March at Nottingham Forest's City Ground.

item.title: Chelsea host Manchester United in Women's FA Cup
item.description: Holders Chelsea will take on Manchester United in the fifth round of the Women's FA Cup - a repeat of last year's final.

item.title: France forward Cascarino joins London City Lionesses
item.description: France forward Delphine Cascarino joins London City Lionesses on a three-and-a-half-year deal after leaving San Diego Wave.

item.title: Will NI's manager search damage World Cup dream?
item.description: BBC Sport NI looks at the Irish Football Association's protracted search to find Tanya Oxtoby's replacement as Northern Ireland Women's manager, almost three months on from the Australian leaving the role.

item.title: Arsenal & Chelsea top women's money league
item.description: Arsenal and Chelsea leapfrog Barcelona to post highest revenue growth in European football after successful 2025.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
